AT ODDS.Definition: if something is at odds with something else, they are different

CATECHISM.Definition: a group of questions or answers about a belief

CLOVER.Definition: a small plant that normally has three round leaves

COMMODITY.Definition: something that can be bought or sold

COUGHING.Definition: when you force air out of your lungs with a short sound

CRASHING.Definition: (of a party) going despite not being invited

CREDIBILITY.Definition: the quality of deserving to be trusted

DEFINE.Definition: say what the meaning of something is

DISCIPLE.Definition: someone who believes in the ideas of someone else

DOCTRINAL.Definition: relating to the set of beliefs that form religion

DOCTRINALLY.Definition: relating to a set of religious beliefs

FATE.Definition: what happens to a particular person or thing

KEEP A LOOKOUT.Definition: pay attention because something bad might happen

KNOCK.Definition: touch in order to make a noise

OUTSIDER.Definition: someone or something who isn't involved with a particular group

OVER AND ABOVE.Definition: above and higher than anything else

PEASANTS.Definition: people who own or rent small pieces of land

PORTRAYED.Definition: represented in a painting, film, or book

PRESUMABLY.Definition: used when you think something is probably true

RECONCILE.Definition: find a way where two situations or beliefs can exist at the same time

SINFUL.Definition: against the rules of a religion

SNEEZE.Definition: when small drops or liquid suddenly come out of your mouth

SNEEZES.Definition: when small drops or liquid suddenly come out of your mouth

SPIKES.Definition: something that's long and thin with a sharp point

SPILLED.Definition: caused to fall on the ground

SPILLING.Definition: causing to fall on the ground

SUNSHADES.Definition: objects similar to umbrellas, but they protect you from sun, not rain

SWEEP.Definition: clean something by using a brush

SWEEPING.Definition: cleaning something by using a brush

TEMPT FATE.Definition: to do something that involves a lot of risk
